Isolated from a marine dinoflagellate culture (Pfiesteria piscicida) in 2000.
Symbiotic, group II photosynthetic strain. The nod genes have not been detected in group II strains. Isolated from stem nodules of Aeschynomene sensitiva in Africa and North America.
Symbiotic, group II photosynthetic strain. The nod genes have not been detected in group II strains. Isolated from stem nodules of Aeschynomene indica in Africa and North America.
Isolated from in situ samplers deployed on the actively venting sulfide mound in the Iheya North hydrothermal field, Japan.
Isolated from field nodules of Echinacea angustifolia growing in Ohio.
Isolated from a mosquito breeding site in China in 1987.
Hyperthermophilic anaerobic bacterium. Isolated from a geothermally heated region of the seafloor near Ribeira Quente, the Azores.

Unable to oxidize hydrogen although hydrogen oxidation was thought to be universal in this group. Isolated from near-neutral-pH terrestrial hot springs in Obsidian Pool in Yellowstone National Park, USA.
Isolated from activated sludge samples from the industrial wastewater treatment facility of Eastman Chemical Company, Kingsport, Tennessee.
Isolated from a slightly alkaline, highly carbonate hot spring water sample from Angel Terrace, which is part of Mammoth Terrace, Yellowstone National Park.
Isolated from a hot wood compost pile (~70 deg C) in Middleton, WI.
Isolated from Obsidian Hot Spring, Yellowstone National Park, Montana, USA.
Isolated from a mixture of sediment samples obtained from different soda lakes located in the Kulunda Steppe (Altai, Russia).
Isolated from a Mimosa occidentalis nodule collected in Tepic, Nayarit, Mexico.
Originally isolated from the crop of a chicken.
Isolated from soil for high-level production of pyrroloquinolone quinone.
Isolated from deep-sea sediment at a water depth of 1855 meters near the Okinawa Trough.
Isolated from nodules of Casuarina equisetifolia trees growing in Mexico.
Isolated from Obsidian Hot Spring, Yellowstone National Park, Montana, USA.
Isolated from a mixed-waste-contaminated subsurface at the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Oak Ridge Reservation in Oak Ridge, TN.
A soil bacterium isolated from the rhizophere of Lupinus luteus. non-virulent species.
Isolated from a seawater sample taken at the Isfjord, Spitsbergen, in autumn 1999.
Isolated from marine subseafloor sediments (31.4 m below the seafloor) collected at a water depth of 755 m at Suruga Bay, Japan.
Isolated from subseafloor sediments at Suruga Bay (Japan) at depths of 31.4 and 41 m.
Isolated from a sample collected from a hydrothermal vent area in the Papua New Guinea-Australia-Canada-Manus (PACMANUS) field of the western Pacific Ocean at a depth of 1,650 m in 2002.
Isolated from soil contaminated by coal tar at the former site of a manufactured gas plant in Chippewa Falls, Wisconsin.
Isolated from rapeseed roots from Uppsala, Sweden in 1998
Isolated from a surface seawater sample collected from a closed bay in the harbour of Pozzuoli (Naples, Italy).
Isolated from a fermented regional kimchi, which was made using the mixture of radish, Chinese cabbage, brown algae, and some seasoning ingredients.
Sulfur-reducing, strictly anaerobic, and hyperthermophilic archaeon. Isolated from the deep-sea hydrothermal vent Guaymas Basin site in the Gulf of California at a depth of 2,000 m.
Originally isolated from an agricultural field in Niigata, Japan, where paddy rice and soybean were rotationally cultivated every 2 years.
Anaerobic ruminal bacterium. Capable of producing a variety of volatile fatty acids. Found in cattle, sheep, and other ruminants.

Grows with H2 and CO2 production. Isolated from 1 of 13 enrichments of coccoid cells obtained from hydrothermal venting structures (East Pacific Rise; a latitude of 13 degrees north, 2,600-m depth) anaerobically on CO at 80 deg C.
Isolated from Gavkhouni Wetland in Iran.
Isolated from a decomposed grapsid crab (Grapsidae) collected from the coast of the West Sea (Incheon, South Korea).
Isolated from a golf course soil in Yongin, Kyongggi-do, South Korea.
Oligotrophic bacterium. Unable to induce root nodules in siratro. Isolated from paddy soil at the experimental farm of Tohoku University, Miyagi, Japan in 1992.
Aerobic, thermophilic bacteria. Isolated from a hot spring in Ulu Slim, Perak, Malaysia, at 92.4 deg C, pH 7.
Isolated from Nashi pears in Japan. Causes bacterial shoot blight of pear.
Isolated from rapeseed roots from Uppsala, Sweden.
Isolated from the soil of a Miscanthus-growing pot in a greenhouse at the University of Seoul.
Wild type producer of the alpha-glucosidase inhibitor acarbose.

Bypasses the denitrification intermediate nitrous oxide by the conversion of two nitric oxide molecules to dinitrogen and oxygen, which was used to oxidize methane. Enriched from Twentekanaal sediment, here designated Twente, and a culture from Ooijpolder ditch sediment.
Extreme haloarchaeon. Capable of growing on synthetic media without amino acid supplements. Isolated from a salt mine in Hubei province, China in the early 1990s.
Isolated from sludge of the biological wastewater treatment plant of a coal tar refinery in Castrop-Rauxel, Germany.
Isolated from soil at an explosives testing facility.
Isolated from deep-sea sediments of the Pacific Ocean.
Polychlorinated-biphenyl-degrading strain. Isolated from a soil sample in Tokyo.
Isolated from deep-sea sediment (at a water depth of 3,800 m) of the Arctic Ocean.

Aerobic type II methanotroph. Expresses two particulate methane monooxygenases. A large repertoire of genes involved in nitrogen metabolism (transport and assimilation of ammonia, hydroxylamine detoxification, nitrogen fixation, and denitrification) was detected. Isolated from a highly polluted aquifer in Germany.
Isolated from the rhizosphere of common reeds growing on the campus of the University of Waterloo.
Obligate endosymbiont of armoured scale insects.
Isolated from an enrichment culture originally sampled at Botanischer Garten, University of Hamburg, Germany.
Isolated from the outflow channel of Dragon Spring, Norris Geyser Basin, in Yellowstone National Park, WY.
Isolated from contaminated soil with technical-HCH (a mixture of alpha-, beta-, gamma-, and delta-isomers of HCH) in India.
Isolated from potato stem on a Finnish field in the 1980s.
Isolated from the outflow channel of Dragon Spring, Norris Geyser Basin, in Yellowstone National Park, WY.
Isolated from Northwestern Mediterranean Sea surface water (0.5 m depth), collected 1 km off the Catalan coast at the Blanes Bay Microbial Observatory.
Isolated from King George Island, Antarctica.
Isolated from bark compost in Okayama, Japan.
Originally isolated in the Philippines from the root nodules of the aquatic legume Sesbania cannabina.
Isolated at the University of Stuttgart from forest soil.
Isolated from the rhizosphere of a duckweed strain, Lemna minor, collected from Shenzhen, China.
Isolated from a gamma-hexachlorocyclohexane-degrading mixed culture.
Isolates from cattle with shipping fever.
Isolated from hypersaline Wadi Nantrun lakes in Egypt.
Isolated from pristine sediments at a background field site in Oak Ridge.
Mesophilic ammonia-oxidizing archaea. Obtained from an agricultural soil.
Isolated from the saliva of pediatric oncohematology patients.
Derived from enrichment cultures initiated with seawater obtained from the North Pacific Ocean at Station ALOHA on Hawaii Ocean Time-series (HOT) cruise 181.
Isolated in May 2009 in Jiangsu Province, China from an Atractylodes macrocephala Koidz plant infected by the pathogen Fusarium oxysporum, which is a causative agent of the root-rot disease.
Isolated in a similar manner, but from seawater obtained from 40 m depth at the Bermuda Atlantic Time-series station.
Isolated from the guts of the honey bee Apis mellifera.
Originally isolated in 1998 from microbial biofilm originally sampled from a ulcerative gingivitis lesion in the oral cavity of a 31-year-old Chinese male from northeast China.
Isolated from a urethral catheterized patient without symptoms of a urinary tract infection in Germany.
Isolated from the rhizosphere of wheat (Triticum aestivum L.) in Yangzhou City, China.
Isolated from the Antarctic seawater with strong antifungal activity against several plant pathogenic fungi. (50.76W, 61.16S, water of depth 786 m)
Isolated from the symbiotic organ of a field-collected R. pedestris bug.

Fast-growing soil mycobacteria. Used for efficient production of key steroid intermediates (androst-4-ene-3,17-dione, androsta-1,4-diene-3,17-dione, 9-hydroxy androst-4-ene-3,17-dione) from phytosterol. Originally isolated from soil samples.
Isolated from non-purified solar salt from solar saltern (E126 deg 06 min 16 sec, N34 deg 35 min 22 sec) in South Korea on August 2013.
Isolated from the gut of waxworms (the larvae of Plodia interpunctella) which are able to chew and eat polyethylene films.
Isolated from surface seawater from the Nile Delta Mediterranean Sea.
Isolated from a biogas-producing lab-scale completely stirred tank reactor optimized for anaerobic digestion of maize silage in co-fermentation with pig and cattle manure.
Isolated from Sea of Japan in Ishikawa Prefecture, Japan.
Isolated from the groundwater polluted with chlorinated ethenes in Japan.
Isolated from a molybdenum mine in Luoyang city.
Isolated from a 90 deg C hot deep-sea sediment sample collected in July of 2012 from the Arctic Jan Mayen Vent Field.
Isolated Pseudomonas sp. strain CCOS 191 from a water sample in Zurich, Switzerland, which is able to form large amounts of cyanide and dissolve phosphate minerals.
Isolated from a diseased white grouper (Epinephelus aeneus) raised on the Red Sea in Israel.
Isolated from tap-water during the enrichment of methanotrophs with methane.
Recovered from cultured tilapia reared in Louisiana.
Isolated from the high-arsenic, sulfidic source pool of Joseph's Coat Hot Spring.
Assembled from a metagenomic sample of deep marine sediments near the Loki's Castle hydrothermal vent in the Arctic Mid-Ocean Ridge.
Isolated from a self-regenerating and self-sustaining biocathode biofilm originally enriched from seawater collected at Rutgers, Marine Field Station (RUMFS) in Tuckerton, New Jersey, USA.
Isolated from a rubber plantation in Bukit Jambul-Penang, Malaysia.
Isolated from a permafrost region in Qinghai-Tibet Plateau.
Isolated from a glacial derived stream at the ablation zone of the East Rathong glacier, West Sikkim (27 deg 33 min 149 sec N, 88 deg 07 min 406 sec E; 4718 masl).
Isolated from a phenanthrene-enrichment culture seeded with a pristine farm soil sample.
Endosymbiont from the dagger nematode Xiphinema americanum, a migratory ectoparasite of numerous crops that also vectors nepovirus. Identified in the gut, ovaries, and eggs.
Isolated from a sample of tidal flat sediment collected at Yeongheung Island, Korea in January 2009.
Sampled from filtered groundwater obtained from an aquifer adjacent to the Colorado River near the town of Rifle, CO, USA.
Isolate from the stem of a soybean plant.
Isolated from a Japanese freshwater stream.
Isolated from soil at Mimomi-Park, Chiba, Japan.
Isolated from the rhizosphere of rice.
Isolated from the topsoil collected near a rusted fire hydrant in Woods Hole, Massachusetts (41 31'44.65''N 70 40'21.5''W) on 7 July 2014.
Isolated from a soil sample affected by the Tohoku tsunami.
Isolated from hotspring at Suwa-shrine, Suwa, Nagano, Japan.
Isolated from soil at the Toyohashi University of Technology, Toyohashi, Aichi, Japan.
Isolated from a soil sample collected in the Qian-jiang area of China.
Isolated from the eutrophic city moat in Xi'an, China.
Isolated from heavy metals-contaminated soil in Xiangxi Tujia and Miao autonomous prefecture, Hunan Province, China.
Isolated from the hot vent, located in the tidal zone of Kunashir Island, Southern Kurils.
Isolated from the feces of a mouse line contaminated following germ-free derivation.
Isolated from Stereocaulon sp., an Arctic lichen collected from Ny-Alesund, Svalbard, Arctic (78 55' N, 11 56' E).
Isolated from field-collected P. microcarpus nodules from the town of Oaxtepec, Morelos, Mexico.
Isolated from Himantormia sp., an Antarctic lichen species collected on Barton Peninsula, King George Island, Antarctica (62 deg 13 min S, 58 deg 47 min W).
Isolated from the stem of a soybean.

Isolated from a biocathode micro- bial community, known as Biocathode-MCL (Marinobacter, Chromatiaceae, Labrenzia), originally enriched from seawater collected at Rutgers Marine Field Station (RUMFS) in Tuckerton, New Jersey, USA.
Isolated from Stereocaulon sp., an Antarctic lichen species collected on Barton Peninsula, King George Island, Antarctica (62 deg 13 min S, 58 deg 47 min W).
Isolated from a mesophilic methanogenic reactor operating with swine manure.
Isolated from crude oil-contaminated coastal sediment near Yeosu of South Korea.
Isolated from Himantormia sp., an Antarctic lichen species collected on Barton Peninsula, King George Island, Antarctica (62 deg 13 min S, 58 deg 47 min W).
Isolated from a brackish lake, Lake Sanaru, in Hamamatsu, Japan.
Isolated from the lichen Stereocaulon sp., collected in Ny-Alesund, Svalbard, Arctic (78 deg 55 min N, 11 deg 56 min E).
Isolated from Big Soda Lake, an arsenic-rich, hypersaline (26 to 88 g/liter total dissolved solids), alkaline (pH 9.7) lake located in Nevada (39 deg 31 min N 118 deg 52 min W).
Isolated from the lichen Usnea sp., collected from Barton Peninsula, King George Island, Antarctica (62 deg 13 min S, 58 deg 47 min W).
Isolated from HCH-contaminated soil in Miyagi prefecture, Japan.
Isolated from a collection of Arctic marine bacteria.
Isolated from composts located in Namhae, Korea.

Isolated from the shallow-sea hydrothermal system.

Isolated from sediments collected in San Francisco Bay, CA.
Collected in Reunion (South West Indian Ocean) from the citrus phyllosphere.
Isolated from a rock core retrieved at a depth of 139.5 m in the subsurface of the Iberian Pyritic Belt (Spain).
Isolated in 2011 from a marine sponge Chondrilla nucula collected off the coast of the Florida Keys.
Isolated from conventionally grown lettuce (Lactuca sativa) from a field in Vestfold, Norway.
Isolated from topsoil in Woods Hole, Massachusetts.
Isolated from Stereocaulon sp., an Arctic lichen.
Isolated from a gamma-HCH-degrading microbial community.
Recovered from human respiratory tract specimen (nasopharyngeal swab).
Isolated from microbial mats from the Zloty Stok mine (SW Poland), an environment strongly contaminated with arsenic.
Isolated from brackish seawater and seaweed off the Gulf coast of Galveston, TX, USA, in 2007.
Isolated from diseased trees. Causes stunting and abnormal root and shoot development in pathogenicity assays.
Isolated from perennially ice-covered Lake Untersee in Antarctica.
Isolated from the South Atlantic in 1984.
Plant-derived strain. Named according to their isolation from broccoli (Brassica oleracea var. italica).
Isolated from goat eyes infected with keratoconjunctivitis.
Isolated from a soil sample at the garden entrance of a house in the Friuli region in Italy in 1987.
Isolated from Lajas Valley, Cabo Rojo, Puerto Rico.
Isolated from the intestine of the reticulated python (Malayopython reticulatus).
Producer of the glycopeptide antibiotic ristocetin.
Isolated as a microcystin producer in 1986 from Lake Vesijarvi, Finland.
Isolated from nitrate- and uranium-contaminated subsurface sediment of the Oak Ridge Integrated Field-Scale Subsurface Research Challenge (IFC) site, Oak Ridge Reservation, TN.
Naturally attenuated subtype of Anaplasma marginale that has been used as a vaccine for a century.

Thermophilic chemolithoautotroph. Capable of growing on hydrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide, and mineral salts. Has not been shown to grow anaerobically with nitrate as an electron acceptor in the laboratory. First observed at the turn of the century, growing at 89 deg C in the outflow of hot springs in Yellowstone National Park.
Dominates the liquid phase of the microbial fuel cell.
Isolated from oil-contaminated soil in Taiwan.
Denitrifying and N2O-reducing betaproteobacterium. Originally isolated from soil of an agricultural field where paddy rice and soybean crops were rotationally cultivated every 2 years.

Bacteria of the genus Azospirillum are found primarily in terrestrial habitats, where they colonize roots of important cereals and other grasses and promote plant growth by several mechanisms including nitrogen fixation and phytohormone secretion.
Isolated from the cadavers of silkworm larvae that had been sick.
Isolated from the nitrate- and uranium-contaminated subsurface of the Oak Ridge Integrated Field Research Challenge (ORIFRC) site, Oak Ridge Reservation, TN.
Isolated from local soil in Japan.
Isolated from the digestive tracts of bumblebees.
Obligate flavobacterial endosymbiont associated with the giant roach Blaberus giganteus.
Primary endosymbiont of the omnivorous cockroach Blatta orientalis, and one of the most ancient symbiotic associations.
Flavobacterial endosymbiont of the termite Mastotermes darwiniensis.
Isolated from a blood sample from a male AIDS patient.
Isolated from patients suffering from mandibular osteomyelitis and chronic suppurative mastoiditis.
Spirochete responsible for tick-borne zoonotic relapsing fever in West Africa, where the soft tick Ornithodoros sonrai is the vector.
Isolated from Ornithodoros parkeri ticks collected from Spermophilus beecheyi burrows in the Carmel Valley of California.
Isolated from Ixodes stilesi ticks present on environmental vegetation and long-tailed rice rats.
Originally isolated in 1993 from the sputum from a cystic fibrosis patient in Leuven, Belgium.
Obligate intracellular amoeba symbiont. Discovered within an amoeba isolated from lake sediment.

Obligate intracellular parasite of Acanthamoeba castellanii. Shows an unusual, fission mode of cell multiplication whereby large, polymorphic bodies accumulate in the cytoplasm of infected amoeba and then split into mature bacterial cells.

Its genome indicates a motile, sporulating, sulfate-reducing, chemoautotrophic thermophile that can fix its own nitrogen and carbon by using machinery shared with archaea. Isolated from low-biodiversity fracture water collected at 2.8-kilometer depth in a South African gold mine.
Isolated from the terrestrial isopod Armadillidium vulgare.
Isolated terrestrial and marine thermal environments.
Isolated from individual psyllids (Trioza erytreae) collected from Pretoria, South Africa.
Methanogen present in the human gut. Enriched from human feces under anaerobic conditions with methanol as the substrate.
Isolated from a pregnant woman who subsequently delivered preterm.
Isolated from a coal tar-contaminated sediment.
Ammonia-oxidizing archaeon. From marine sediment off Svalbard, the Arctic Circle (78-m-deep).
Originating from coastal surface waters of the Northern Adriatic Sea.
Isolated from a surface seawater sample collected off the coastal region in Ny-Aalesund, Svalbard, Norway.
Isolated from a surface seawater sample from the Western Pacific Ocean Margin (East Sea of Korea).
Isolated from surface waters (5 m) in Puget Sound.
Isolated from deep-sea sediment from the Indian Ocean.
Isolated from coastal seawater from Yellow Sea of Korea.
Isolated from a mesophilic two-phase lab-scale biogas reactor continuously fed with maize silage and wheat straw.
Toxin-free strain for bacteriolytic tumor therapy.
Isolated from a human throat specimen.
Isolated during the 1980s from putrefied bananas.
Isolated from petroleum deposits of the sunken tanker "Amoco Milford Haven" (Gulf of Genoa, Ligurian Sea, Italy).
Isolated from the oil-production water in Xinjiang Oilfield, China.

Sulfate-reducing bacteria. Capable of reducing Fe(III). Utilizes a wide spectrum of energy sources, ranging from aromatic compounds to short-chained fatty acids. Capable of growing chemolithoautotrophically on hydrogen. Isolated from groundwater contaminated with motor fuel [mostly benzene, toluene ethylbenzene and xylene (BTEX) compounds] in sandy soil near Perth, Australia.

Sulfate-reducing bacteria. Capable of reducing Fe(III). Utilizes a wide spectrum of energy sources, ranging from aromatic compounds to short-chained fatty acids. Capable of growing chemolithoautotrophically on hydrogen. Isolated from a soil sample from Singapore.
Isolated from the hindgut of the wood-feeding termite Reticulitermes speratus KMT1.
Isolated from a sterile-filtered gut homogenate of Reticulitermes santonensis.
Isolated from the stem of a 10-year-old hybrid poplar (Populus trichocarpa x P. deltoids cv. H11-11).
Isolated from a biofilm sample of Ginger Lake on King George Island, Antarctic peninsula.
Acidophilic archaeon. Isolated from enrichment cultures inoculated with mine water and sediment samples collected in July 1997 from the five-way site within the Richmond Mine.
Isolated from soil of ginseng field.
Isolated from a laboratory culture of the marine ciliate Euplotes raikovi.

Isolated from a crustacean shell (crab) which was collected on the 22nd May 2012 at low tide (8:30 a.m.) at 16 deg C ambient temperature in some residue water on the tidal mud flat of the German Wadden Sea, Neuharlingersiel (53 deg 42 min 15.5 sec N, 7 deg 42 min 15.9 sec E).
Originally isolated from a microbial fuel cell reactor in the United States.
Isolated from surface water of the southeastern Pacific.
Isolated from coastal waters near St John's Island, US Virgin Islands.
Isolated from early Cretaceous (~123 million years old) halite from the depth of 2000 m in Qianjiang Depression, Hubei Province, China.
Isolated from soda solonchak soils of the Kulunda steppe, Russian Federation.
Isolated from a hypersaline lake in Oregon.
Isolated from the cecal and fecal content of Il10-/- knockout mice with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
Isolated from a thermophilic biogas plant.
Thermoacidophilic isolate from a stream adjacent to Obsidian Pool in Yellowstone National Park, United States.
Isolated from air in a school dining room in Russia in 1967.
Isolated from Pacific coastal seawater (Bodega Head, CA; salinity = 33) in 2003.
Freshwater-borne small bacterium. Isolated over a 7.5-mo period before it was eradicated by repairing the UPW production and distribution system.
Isolated from high-level radioactive waste within a shielded cell work area at the Savannah River Site (SRS).
Produce setamycin (bafilomycin B1) possessing antitrichomonal activity.
Isolated from the air of Xinjiang of China.
Isolated from saline sediment collected from Yantai City in China.
Most frequently encountered serovar. Causes leptospirosis and tubulointerstitial nephritis in Taiwan.

Acidophilic, obligate chemolithoautotrophic ferrous-iron-oxidizing bacterium. Known to have nitrogenase-encoding genes. Isolated from a 7.6-year-old volcanic ash deposit on Mount Oyama in the island of Miyake, Japan by chemostat enrichment.
Isolated from kimchi made of cabbage.
Isolated from the sediment of a meromictic lake in Japan.
Isolated from grassland soil in the German Biodiversity Exploratories.
Isolated from an electronic-waste-contaminated river sediment from Guiyu, Guangdong, China.
One of the first magnetotactic bacterium strains available in axenic lab culture. Isolated in the mud of the little eutrophic Ryck River near Greifswald, Germany.
Synthesizes nano-sized magnetites, referred to as magnetosomes, aligned intracellularly in a chain. Isolated from fresh water in Tokyo, Japan.
Isolated from surface seawaters collected off the Oregon coast.
Isolated from the phycosphere of the toxin-producing dinoflagellate Gymnodinium catenatum strain YC499B15 in 2003.
Isolated from a petroleum-contaminated soil with high salinity in China.
Non-photosynthetic bacteria. Isolated from microbial mats developing in streams of hydrothermal water at the Tomsk region of Russia.

Isolated from a mesothermic anaerobic 2,3,5,6-tetrachlorobiphenyl-ortho-dechlorinating microbial enrichment culture inoculated with anaerobic sediments taken from the Northwest Branch of Baltimore Harbor, Baltimore, Maryland.
Extremely thermoacidophilic and metal sulfide-oxidizing archaeon.
Isolated from a near circumneutral temperate minerotrophic fen in New York State, USA.
Isolated from a rural biogas plant producing methane-rich biogas from maize silage and cattle manure in Germany.
Isolated from a cyanobacterial mat and bottom deposits at Hamelin Pool, Shark Bay, northwestern Australia.
Isolated from a freshwater wetland: the Zoige wetland of the Tibetan Plateau.
Human intestinal inhabitant. Capable of generating methane only by reduction of methanol with H2 and is dependent on acetate as a carbon source.
Originally isolated from an acidic forest soil in Germany.
Isolated from the head kidney of an Atlantic salmon diagnosed with winter-ulcer disease.

Capable of removing organic sulfur from a broad range of sulfur species in gasoline, diesel and crude oils. Isolated as a bacterial strain capable of desulfurizing dibenzothiophene via the sulfur-specific pathway under high temperature.
Isolated from a Thai red ginger flower at the National Institute of Technology and Evaluation Biological Resource Center, Japan.
Isolated from in situ samplers deployed on the actively venting sulfide mound in the Iheya North hydrothermal field, Japan.
Facultative chemolithoautotroph. Capable of extracting energy from the oxidation of nitrite to nitrate.
Obligate chemolithoautotroph. Derives all its energy and reductant for growth from the oxidation of ammonia to nitrite.
Obligate chemolithotrophic ammonia-oxidizing bacterium. Originally isolated in 1997.
Ammonia-oxidizing bacteria. Isolated from soil near Paramaribo, Surinam, by enrichment culturing.
Nitrite-oxidizing bacteria. Reconstructed from an activated sludge enrichment culture.
Isolated from a fatal human nocardiosis case at Washington, DC, in the 1970s.
Isolated from sea ice of the Antarctic.
Isolated from a surface water sample collected in the harbor of the island of Helgoland in the North Sea.
Isolated from the hydrocarbon-enrichment set-up from the Antarctic seawater.
Isolated from the hindgut of the wood-feeding termite Reticulitermes flavipes.
Isolated from soil litter surrounding oxalate-producing plant of the genus Oxalis.

Effective diazotrophic symbiont of the leguminous tree Mimosa flocculosa Burkart, which is endemic to South America. Highly specific and effective in fixing nitrogen with the host species and is unusual in its capacity to grow in vitro at 40 deg C without losing its symbiotic properties. Isolated from a root nodule of Mimosa flocculosa, endemic to southern South America.
Isolated from sea ice at high-latitude Arctic locations (77deg 30min N to approximately 81deg 12min N), including the Canadian Basin and Greenland Sea.
Isolated from a soil sample collected in King George Island, Antarctica (62 deg 14 min 11 sec S, 58 deg 43 min 04 sec W).
Isolated from an algal mat collected from a sulfurous spring in Campania (Italy).

Capable of growing on cis-1,2-dichloroethene (cDCE) as a sole carbon and energy source and may be useful for bioremediation of chlorinated solvent-contaminated sites. Isolated from a granular activated-carbon filter treating chloroethene-contaminated groundwater.
Isolated from the thallus of Fucus evanescens (marine brown macroalgae) sampled from the Kraternaya Bight of the Kurile Islands in the Pacific Ocean.
Isolated from a decaying amphipod collected at a depth of 5,700 m in the central North Pacific Ocean.
Isolated from the benthal mud of a petroleum-contaminated site in Bohai Sea, China.

Hyperthermophilic, anaerobic, and heterotrophic archaeon. Grows well at 95 deg C on maltose, cellobiose, or peptides with concomitant production of H2S from elemental sulfur and H2 in relatively equal proportions. Isolated in May 2004 from a piece of a deep-sea hydrothermal sulfide chimney on the Endeavour Segment of the Juan de Fuca Ridge in the northeastern Pacific Ocean.
Isolated from a contaminated terrestrial subsurface environment.

Metabolically versatile, Fe(III)-reducing, facultative anaerobic microorganism. Converts sugars to electricity, oxidizing the sugars to carbon dioxide with quantitative electron transfer to graphite electrodes in microbial fuel cells. Isolated from subsurface sediments in Oyster Bay, VA.
Photosynthetic purple nonsulfur bacterium. Favors growth in an anoxygenic, photosynthetic N2-fixing environment. Originated from hot spring mud in Wyoming, United States.
Isolated from the soil of Lengduo on the Tibet plateau of China.
Isolated from the top aerobic sediment layer of the hypersaline chloride-sulfate Lake Baskunchak (south Russia).

Isolated from an anaerobic enrichment culture inoculated with slurries of a cyanobacterial mat retrieved from the hypersaline Lake 21 on the Kiritimati atoll (Northern Line Islands, Republic of Kiribati).
Isolated from La Jolla beach in San Diego, California.
Isolated from the active sludge of a wastewater-treatment system of a pesticide manufacturer in Hangzhou City, China.
Originally discovered as a contaminant of a human cell culture. obligate intracellular bacterium.
Isolated from a hand wound following impalement with a tree branch.
Isolated from the gut of a green-eyed horsefly (Tabanus nigrovittatus), collected at Ocracoke Island in North Carolina in 1983.
Isolated from faecal samples of Tibetan antelopes.
Synthesizes the antibiotic roseoflavin, a structural riboflavin (vitamin B2) analog.
Isolated from soil sample derived from Gaza Ki, Wakayama Pref. Japan.
Isolated from the hypolimnion of Lake Mizugaki, a freshwater lake.
Isolated from anoxic mud of a forest pond near Heinigen, Braunschweig area, Germany.
Isolated from activated sludge of a wastewater treatment plant.
Isolated from the edge of California Current at a depth of 95m in 1993.

Moderately thermophilic and strictly anaerobic for growth. Capable of fermenting quite a number of amino acids. The growth and the substrate conversion are strongly enhanced by co-cultivation with methanogens. Grows lithoheterotrophically with H2 as electron donor, S0 as electron acceptor, and yeast extract as carbon source. Isolated from sludge sample taken from an upflow anaerobic sludge bed (UASB) reactor of a sugar refinery in The Netherlands.

Aerobic, obligately thermophilic organism. Has two distinct types of transcriptionally active 16S rRNA genes. Utilizes inositol and rhamnose for growth, but does not hydrolyze starch and utilize arabinose and glycerol. Negative for iodinin production and nitrate reduction. Isolated from decaying manure in Berlin, Germany in 1954.
Isolated from a Paralvinella sp. polychaete worm collected from a hydrothermal vent on the Endeavor Segment in the NorthEastern Pacific Ocean.
Isolated from the deep-sea hydrothermal vent field Beebe, in the Cayman Trough, at 4964-m water depth (18 deg 32.7881= N, 81 deg 43.11844= W).
Isolated from a mud sample from a black mud pit (86 deg C, pH 5.5) located near Pauzhetka (Kamchatka Peninsula, Russia).
Isolated from municipal refuse compost samples.

Hyperthermophilic, heterotrophic, strictly anaerobic and fermentative phenotype. Isolated from water and sediment samples of a terrestrial circumneutral hot solfataric spring ("Obsidian Pool") located in the Mud Volcano area of the Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming.
Isolated from the Geysir geothermal area, Iceland.
Isolated from deep-sea water of the Southeastern Pacific.
Isolated from a hydrothermal vent chimney in the Okinawa Trough.
Isolated from seawater collected from the Red Sea in 2009.
Isolated from contaminated Leptospira culture medium.
Isolated from a deep marine sediment sample collected from the East Sea (Sea of Japan).
Isolated from the culture broth of Picochlorum sp. 122 (marine microalgae) sampled from the Indian Ocean.
Isolated from seawater samples collected in the Sagami Bay (35 degrees 00 minutes=N, 139 degrees 20 minutes=E; depth, 100 m).
faeces of wild japanese wood mouse
surface of a eutrophic freshwater pond
fermented brine used for stinky tofu production
composting material of distilled shochu residue
walls of a distilled spirit fermenting cellar
fu-tsai, a traditional fermented mustard product
yeast storage tank containing lager beer
faeces of a japanese healthy adult male
fermented cane molasses of alcohol plants
